description: From Middle English morhen, perhaps from  Old English *mōrhenn, an alteration of Old English wōrhenn (compare coordinate masculine term mōrhana, a possible corruption of wōrhana (“pheasant”)), equivalent to moor +‎ hen.

entries.meaning: Any of various medium-sized water birds of the genus Gallinula, of the rail family, that feed in open water margins.
(Britain) A female red grouse, Lagopus lagopus scotica.
